text: was a member of the Japanese imperial family and general of the army. He was the prime minister of Japan from 17 August to 9 October 1945. He is the only member of the Japanese imperial family to head a cabinet, and Japan's shortest-serving prime minister, serving for only 54 days. ==References== Category:1887 births Category:1990 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Japan Category:Japanese princes and princesses Category:Japanese military people Category:Japanese centenarians
title: Prince Naruhiko Higashikuni
